org.w3c.dom.as
Interface ASModel

All Superinterfaces:
ASObject
public interface ASModel
extends ASObject

To begin with, an abstract schema is a generic structure that could contain both internal and external subsets. An ASModel is an abstract object that could map to a DTD , an XML Schema , a database schema, etc. An ASModel could represent either an internal or an external subset; hence an abstract schema could be composed of an ASModel representing the internal subset and an ASModel representing the external subset. Note that the ASModel representing the external subset could consult the ASModel representing the internal subset. Furthermore, the ASModel representing the internal subset could be set to null by the setInternalAS() method as a mechanism for "removal". In addition, only one ASModel representing the external subset can be specified as "active" and it is possible that none are "active". Finally, the ASModel contains the factory methods needed to create a various types of ASObjects like ASElementDecl, ASAttributeDecl, etc.

See also the Document Object Model (DOM) Level 3 Abstract Schemas and Load and Save Specification.

          The ASModel is neither used as an internal or external subset.

Method Detail

getNamespaceAware

boolean getNamespaceAware()
true if this ASModel defines the document structure is namespace-aware ; false if the document structure is non-namespace-aware.

representsXMLSchema

boolean representsXMLSchema()
Added by X-Hive: true if this ASModel defines an XML Schema, false if it represents a DTD.

getUsage

short getUsage()
Uses INTERNAL_SUBSET, EXTERNAL_SUBSET, or NOT_USED. An exception will be raised if it is incompatibly shared or in use as an internal subset.

getLocation

java.lang.String getLocation()
The URI reference. For example, if an ASModel modeled a DTD, this could represent the system identifier; if an ASModel modeled a XML schema, this could act as a hint to the location of a schema document. In addition, if a system identifier doesn't exist for an internet subset, then this attribute can be NULL.

setLocation

void setLocation(java.lang.String location)
The URI reference. For example, if an ASModel modeled a DTD, this could represent the system identifier; if an ASModel modeled a XML schema, this could act as a hint to the location of a schema document. In addition, if a system identifier doesn't exist for an internet subset, then this attribute can be NULL.

getHint

java.lang.String getHint()
The hint to locating an ASModel. For example, if an ASModel modeled a DTD, this could represent the public identifier; if an ASModel modeled a XML schema, this could represent a target namespace of a schema document. This attribute can also be NULL.

setHint

void setHint(java.lang.String hint)
The hint to locating an ASModel. For example, if an ASModel modeled a DTD, this could represent the public identifier; if an ASModel modeled a XML schema, this could represent a target namespace of a schema document. This attribute can also be NULL.

getContainer

boolean getContainer()
If usage is EXTERNAL_SUBSET or NOT_USED, and the ASModel is simply a container of other ASModels.

getElementDecls

ASNamedObjectMap getElementDecls()
Instead of returning an all-in-one ASObject with ASModel methods, have discernible top-level (appearing directly on the ASModel) element declarations. If one attempts to add, set, or remove a object type other than the intended one, a hierarchy exception (or equivalent) is thrown. In addition, these element declarations can be incomplete, meaning that elements declared through an attribute list but without any corresponding element declarations can be represented and their content models undefined, as noted by the AS_UNDEFINED constant.

getAttributeDecls

ASNamedObjectMap getAttributeDecls()
Instead of returning an all-in-one ASObject with ASModel methods, have discernible top-level attribute declarations, i.e., not bound to sepecific element types but bound to the ASModel. If one attempts to add, set, or remove a object type other than the intended one, a hierarchy exception (or equivalent) is thrown. In addition, these attribute declarations can be associated with an incomplete element declaration, essentially an element with an undefined content model, indicated by the AS_UNDEFINED constant.

getNotationDecls

ASNamedObjectMap getNotationDecls()
Instead of returning an all-in-one ASObject with ASModel methods, have discernible top-level notation declarations. If one attempts to add, set, or remove a object type other than the intended one, a hierarchy exception (or equivalent) is thrown.

getEntityDecls

ASNamedObjectMap getEntityDecls()
Instead of returning an all-in-one ASObject with ASModel methods, have discernible top-level entity declarations. If one attempts to add, set, or remove a object type other than the intended one, a hierarchy exception (or equivalent) is thrown.

getContentModelDecls

ASNamedObjectMap getContentModelDecls()
Instead of returning an all-in-one ASObject with ASModel methods, have discernible top-level content model declarations. If one attempts to add, set, or remove a object type other than the intended one, a hierarchy exception (or equivalent) is thrown.

addASModel

void addASModel(ASModel abstractSchema)
This method will allow the nesting or "importation" of ASModels.

Parameters:
abstractSchema - ASModel to be set. Subsequent calls will nest the ASModels within the specified ownerASModel.

getASModels

ASObjectList getASModels()
To retrieve a list of nested or "imported" ASModels without reference to names.

Returns:
A list of ASModels.

removeAS

void removeAS(ASModel as)
Removes only the specified ASModel from the list of ASModels.

Parameters:
as - AS to be removed.

validate

boolean validate()
Determines if an ASModel itself is valid, i.e., confirming that it's well-formed and valid per its own formal grammar.

Returns:
true if the ASModel is valid, false otherwise.

importASObject

void importASObject(ASObject asobject)
Imports ASObject into ASModel.

Parameters:
asobject - ASObject to be imported.

insertASObject

void insertASObject(ASObject asobject)
Inserts ASObject into ASModel.

Parameters:
asobject - ASObject to be inserted.

createASElementDecl

ASElementDecl createASElementDecl(java.lang.String namespaceURI,
                                  java.lang.String name)
                                  throws ASException
Creates an element declaration for the element type specified.

Parameters:
namespaceURI - The namespace URI of the element type being declared.
name - The name of the element. The format of the name could be an NCName as defined by XML Namespaces or a Name as defined by XML 1.0; it's ASModel-dependent.
Returns:
A new ASElementDecl object with the ASObject objectName attribute set to name and namespaceURI set to namespaceURI. Other attributes of the element declaration are set through ASElementDecl and ASObject interface methods. Depending on the value of NamespaceAware, this method will take into account the namespaceURI parameter.
Throws:
ASException - INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR: Raised if the specified name contains an illegal character.

createASAttributeDecl

ASAttributeDecl createASAttributeDecl(java.lang.String namespaceURI,
                                      java.lang.String name)
                                      throws ASException
Creates an attribute declaration.

Parameters:
namespaceURI - The namespace URI of the attribute being declared.
name - The name of the attribute. The format of the name could be an NCName as defined by XML Namespaces or a Name as defined by XML 1.0; it's ASModel-dependent.
Returns:
A new ASAttributeDecl object with appropriate attributes set by input parameters.
Throws:
ASException - INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR: Raised if the input name parameter contains an illegal character.

createASNotationDecl

ASNotationDecl createASNotationDecl(java.lang.String namespaceURI,
                                    java.lang.String name,
                                    java.lang.String systemId,
                                    java.lang.String publicId)
                                    throws ASException
Creates a new notation declaration.

Parameters:
namespaceURI - The namespace URI of the notation being declared.
name - The name of the notation. The format of the name could be an NCName as defined by XML Namespaces or a Name as defined by XML 1.0; it's ASModel-dependent.
systemId - The URI reference for the notation declaration.
publicId - The public identifier for the notation declaration.
Returns:
A new ASNotationDecl object with notationName attribute set to name and publicId and systemId set to the corresponding fields.
Throws:
ASException - INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR: Raised if the specified name contains an illegal character.

createASEntityDecl

ASEntityDecl createASEntityDecl(java.lang.String name)
                                throws ASException
Creates an ASEntityDecl.

Parameters:
name - The name of the entity being declared.
Returns:
A new ASEntityDecl object with entityName attribute set to name.
Throws:
ASException - INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR: Raised if the specified name contains an illegal character.

createASContentModel

ASContentModel createASContentModel(java.lang.String name,
                                    java.lang.String namespaceURI,
                                    int minOccurs,
                                    int maxOccurs,
                                    short operator)
                                    throws ASException
Creates an object which describes part of an ASElementDecl 's content model.

Parameters:
name - The name of this ASContentModel.
namespaceURI - The namespace URI of this ASContentModel.
minOccurs - The minimum occurrence for the subModels of this ASContentModel.
maxOccurs - The maximum occurrence for the subModels of this ASContentModel.
operator - operator of type AS_CHOICE, AS_SEQUENCE, AS_ALL or AS_NONE.
Returns:
A new ASContentModel object.
Throws:
ASException - A ASException, e.g., minOccurs > maxOccurs.

createASDataType

ASDataType createASDataType(short type)
Create a ASDataType object. Added by X-Hive: This method is needed for setting types on attributes

Parameters:
type - One of the ASDataType constants.

getElementDecl

ASElementDecl getElementDecl(java.lang.String targetNamespace,
                             java.lang.String name)
Returns a top-level element declaration. Added by X-Hive: Taken from later version of the specification, to have some interaction between the AS-EDIT and AS-DOC parts.

Parameters:
name - The name of the declaration.
targetNamespace - The namespace of the declaration, otherwise null.
Returns:
A top-level element declaration or null if such declaration does not exist.

Parameters:
name - The name of the declaration.
targetNamespace - The namespace of the declaration, otherwise null.
Returns:
A top-level attribute declaration or null if such declaration does not exist.

Returns an entity declaration. Added by X-Hive: Taken from later version of the specification, to have some interaction between the AS-EDIT and AS-DOC parts.

Parameters:
name - The name of the declaration.
Returns:
An entity declaration or null if such declaration does not exist.

                               java.lang.String name)

Parameters:

Returns:

getCatalogId

long getCatalogId()
Return the unique id this ASModel has in the catalog, or -1 if it's an internal subset (and thus has no id)
Added by X-Hive/DB.

getXSModel

XSModel getXSModel()
Return the XSModel of this model. An XSModel is the object representation of an XML Schema. This interface is part of the Xerces XML Schema API.
